column1: Research grants are available to individuals only, and applicants must be members of the Royal Scottish Geographical Society. &nbsp
column2: No more than one application can be accepted from an individual per year, and re-applications for the same project are not acceptable. &nbsp
column3: Awards cannot be made retrospectively, and applications must be submitted in time for them to be considered by the Society's Research Committee. &nbsp
column4: The closing date for applications is 31st January each year.

column1: The linked application form (in HTML or MS Word document format) may be printed or used as a template.
column2: Alternatively, a printed copy may be obtained from the Society's Administrative Officer at the address below. &nbsp
column3: Please print on only one side of the paper. &nbsp
column4: On completion the form should be submitted with supporting documents. &nbsp
column5: Word processed and electronically submitted forms are acceptable, but must follow the prescribed page layout.

column1: Forms for reports from two referees are provided with the application form, and applicants are responsible for sending the form to each of the referees, together with a copy of the application, and ensuring that the referees' reports have been sent to the Society in advance of the closing date. &nbsp
column2: Applications will not normally be considered unless both references have been received by the closing date. &nbsp
column3: The two referees should be familiar with the applicant's work, one being from outside the applicant's institution. &nbsp
column4: The panel may contact others as necessary.

column1: The Research Committee will review applications and approve the grant to be awarded at its meeting in February. &nbsp
column3: All applicants will be notified in writing within one month of the Research Committee meeting, and details of the awards will be published in the Society's GeogScot Newsletter.
column4: It is regretted that no correspondence will be entered into except under exceptional circumstances. &nbsp
column5: The grant will be paid, subject to the applicant accepting the offer, when expenditure is about to be incurred. &nbsp
column6: Any grant not taken up within one year will be cancelled.

column1: The award-holder is requested to submit a report within one year of being offered a research grant. &nbsp
column2: This report, extending to no more than two sides of an A4 sheet, should include a full statement of how the money was spent, details of any other funds obtained, and a list of publications or conference papers resulting from the award. &nbsp
column3: The Society's support should be acknowledged in any publication, and a copy of all the publications sent to the Society. &nbsp
column4: Money not spent as outlined in the application must be refunded.
